ENTRY.refkeywords: profile circular elliptical radial ellipse plot plotting resid residual residuals
ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: Plot a radial or elliptical profile of the residuals (data - model) to imaging data.

SYNTAX.LINE: prof_resid( [id], [model=None, rstep=None, rmin=None, rmax=None, rlo=None, rhi=None, xpos=None, ypos=None, ellip=None, theta=None, group_counts=None, group_snr=None, label=True, recalc=True, overplot=False, clearwindow=True] )

DESC.PARA: The prof_resid command calculates the radial - or elliptical - profile of the residuals to imaging data (data - model) and plots it. The profile is defined by the existing model compenents, although it is possible to over-ride these values.
The residual values are calculated as data - model The prof_delchi() command can be used if you want to plot (data - model) / error
The routine can be loaded into Sherpa by saying:
The argument options are the same as for the prof_data() command, and are described in its ahelp page.

The get_resid_prof_prefs() returns the current plot preferences used by prof_resid(). Changing these settings will therefore change the appearance of any new plots created by prof_resid(). For example
will cause any new residual plots to use logarithmic scaling for the X axis. A full list of the preferences can be found by saying
The preferences are set so that the x axis should be drawn using log scaling. Setting the get_resid_prof_prefs values only affects new plots made after the setting was changed.
The residuals are plotted after the bins have been grouped so that each bin has a signal to noise ratio of 15 or more, where the calculation is done using the data and not the residual values.
Calculate the residual profile in radial bins with low/high limits of 0-10, 10-20, 20-40, 40-60, 60-100, 100-200.
